reportDatesBetween
Calculation of the reporting period between two dates.
Not used in algorithms like "Algorithm. Condition for visual"
(even as a comment).
Syntax
reportDatesBetween
(period, startDate, endDate)
Setting
Purpose
period
The period type, which is selected in the "Calculating number of reporting dates in a range" modal window when the function is called.
startDate
Deductible date ("Date" type attribute).
The current date is set by default - currentDate().
endDate
Decrementable date ("Date" type attribute).
The current date is set by default - currentDate().
Note
The function is called using the
button, located in the Algorithm Editor on the "Date" tab.
The "Calculating number of reporting dates in a range" modal window opens, where the period type is selected.
Next, instead of the default values, set the dates between which to calculate the amount of the selected period.
The result >=0 is reached
with a direct calendar chronology
(from date1 to the subsequent date2).
The result ‚áê0 is reached
with a reverse chronology
(date1 later than date2).
Examples
Example 1
To calculate the number of nights spent in the hotel, use an algorithm that calculates the difference between the "check-in date" and the "check-out date". The period is calculated in days.
Example 2
Return the difference in days between the two generated dates.
The result of executing the algorithm: 5.
Example 3
Get the difference in months between the dates in the reverse chronology.
The result of executing the algorithm: -12.
The date is a complex structure and should not be queried from the user in any format.
If it is necessary to generate a specific date from the individual components, it must be entered in a variable of the algorithm.
This is implemented by calling the new constructor, which creates an instance of the LocalDate class.
